lyrics.lyrics: It was late at night, you held on tight
From an empty seat, a flash of light
It will take a while to make you smile
Somewhere in these eyes, I'm on your side
You wide-eyed girls, you get it right
Fall back into place
Fall back into place
Tender is the night for a broken heart
Who will dry your eyes when it falls apart?
What makes this fragile world go 'round?
Were you ever lost? Was she ever found?
Somewhere in these eyes
Fall back into place
Fall back into place
Fall back into place (fall back into place)
Fall back into place (fall back into place)
Fall back into place (fall back into place)
Fall back into place (fall back into place)
Fall back into place (fall back into place)
Fall back into place (fall back into...)

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
It will take a while
 To make you smile
annotation: The pain that has been caused between the two former lovers is not easily ameliorated. Therefore, in order for one of them to smile at the other, a lot of effort and work will be required. And thusly, so will a lot of time be required.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics: What makes this fragile world go ’round?
annotation: The narrator here is singing about the popular quote “Love makes the world go ‘round”, but love is what she lost, so she’s wondering if it isn’t love that made the world go 'round, then what was?

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Somewhere in these eyes
 I’m on your side
annotation: Betrayal, hurt, and dissatisfaction is what this relationship has grown to be. But in the eyes, somewhere deep and buried, there is still the love and kinship that was once shared between them.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Fall back into place
 Fall back into place
annotation: People go through the normal routine and motions of life until love comes out of the blue and knocks you off your feet— you literally experience the sensation of falling. The narrator depicts the end of the relationship as falling, but in reverse— going back in time before you didn’t know the person who made such a profound impact on your life. You return to life as it was before you fell in love, with nothing but the memories of the person you fell for.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Were you ever lost?
 Was she ever found?
 Somewhere in these eyes
annotation:
Those lines might mean that he never loved her.

Somewhere in these eyes

connects back to the second verse.

Interpreting the lines:

Somwhere in these eyes
I’m on your side

of the second verse as her wishing that he still loves her (she’s searching his eyes for traces of her) explains the verse.
The speaker asks: were he lost without her? Were her traces found in his eyes?

Another meaning could be that the speaker asks himself if he was ever really in love.
Perhaps, “Was she ever found” asks if the girl was ever loved by someone after that relationship, like one finds a hidden gem.
Somone who appreciates and lovers her like he never could.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
You wide-eyed girls
 You get it right
annotation:
Wide eyed girls refers to the idea of a naive and hopeful person looking forward to an idealized relationship. The image is often used to portray a young girl who is falling in love for the first time. It is also said that when people look at someone they love, their pupils expand, so it could mean that many girls fell in love with him.

Also, if eyes are the “gateway to the soul,” then this may represent the complexity of the girl’s young and growing mind, her world full of intrigue and character.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
It was late at night
 You held on tight
 From an empty seat
 A flash of light
annotation:
Late night is a time of intimacy and uncontrollable honesty. As Ray Bradbury put it,

“The soul is out. The blood moves slow.  You’re the nearest to dead you’ll ever be save dying.”

In the darkness, the huge disconnect in their relationship is revealed. Their significant other knows this is where the relationship will end, but holds on tightly anyway, holding out for the hope that the romance can be salvaged.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Tender is the night
 For a broken heart
 Who will dry your eyes
 When it falls apart?
annotation:
Whilst fans of music may be most familiar with the phrase “tender is the night” from the Blur song, it was derived from the title of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s final novel. In turn, Fitzgerald took it from “Ode to a Nightingale”, a poem by John Keats.

Already with thee! tender is the night,
And haply the Queen-Moon is on her throne,
Cluster’d around by all her starry Fays;
But here there is no light

“Tender” and Tender Is The Night deal with collapsing relationships, whilst “Ode to a Nightingale” also explores death. After a breakup, your partner will not be around to comfort you – and after death, nobody will ever comfort you again.

This phrase was also used by Canadian rockers Destroyer in their track “Sun in the Sky” from their album Poison Season; both Depression Cherry and Poison Season were released on August 28, 2015.

sections.explanation: The lyrics begin, introducing the narrative of a past, tender love.
The section transitions to a repeated line, emphasizing the theme of falling back into place.
The middle section explores deeper existential questions and relationships.
The repeated chorus returns again, anchoring the song back to its central motif.
The song closes with the repeated line 'Fall back into place,' fading out.

song_start.explanation: The song opens with an instrumental section, setting up the ethereal and dreamy mood of the song.

song_end.explanation: The song ends in a fade out, leaving a lingering sense of emotion and thought.
